summary: Chainmail, scalemail, leather- no cleavage. MOD ON HOLD- I apologize.
descriptionHtml:
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=5][b]
This mod is officially on hold. [/b][/size][/font]

Current part list:
Leather, Six variations (gloves, gloves 2, fancy boots, pleated boots, fur-top boots, short-boots, foldover boots, imperial boots, imperial bracers, hard leather helmet, imperial helmet, leather hood, leather hood 2, leather cap, brigandine sleeved, brigandine sleevless, and three leather jacket variations.)

Metals, Four+ variants (imperial vambraces, shin boots, helmet and armor, stormcloak helm, iron "dragonborn" helm, companions jawbone helm, basic steel helm, steel plate gauntlets, boots, helmet, and armor, nordic cuffed boots and gauntlets, both steel armors, chainmail shirts and hoods, scalemale brigandines sleeved and unsleeved.)

In the future I intend to bring in more Witcher ports, with separate textures and several metal variants. As well as much needed shields!





SURVEY HERE: [url=http://kwiksurveys.com/s.asp?sid=h9gbjqcx2he242k460209]clack
[/url]
The best help you can give me is better direction. This initial survey will
help me. It's a purely information oriented survey, so don't expect me
to make any money off it or anything. If anything it probably makes
money for the people hosting it. I didn't feel like paying for one or
two surveys so sorry about that.

Even better though would be meshing. Contact me if you'd like an if not dedicated, a decent texture
artist to make variants of your work, off of remeshes or all new meshes.
All I ask is mesh usage for this mod with credit given in entirety.

NEW Update: Uploading the last bit of work I've done so you can at least
have shields. Be forewarned of oddities like test armor and my as of yet
unseparated Fist of the North Star armor pieces. [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/images/473095/?](that jagi helmet is bad-ass though...)[/url]Â There are also some minor armor build glitches. Meaning the model is set up
wrong and the skinny mesh is the buff one and vice verse. This isn't
widespread though.

Last UPDATE: Changed my envmaps, changed some textures, added some stuff, and finally got some stuff craftable. The
barest implementation of my new crafting system is taking place. It will
be an optional file that requires you to make rings and scales before
you make your armor, and will involve them for fixes and crafting. I've
also equalized two leather colors. Black, and work-glove tan. Please
tell me which you all think should stay, and which one should become
ivory leather. (ala Assassin's Creed 2 and other sources. leather that's
a dullish white) several tones. It's almost all craftable, with a test
cell to try it out, called "tf_armorzone"



But it's not done. I'd like all your help to guide me in where this needs to go. What
colors are good, what might work as alternates, good varied
screenshots, etc. Anyway, until then, I'll be slowly building a good
descriptive page for this, as well as my own screens and improvements.
Thanks, and good luck!

And don't worry too much. This mod has been at least tested by a team of two for months. It's just that two
aren't much compared to a broader array of people with more varied
perspectives.

[img]http://static-3.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/57755-1-1411942705.gif[/img]
author: The_Funktasm
